newsitem.title: USA: Tech stocks plunge on Cisco fears, Intel downgrade.
newsitem.headline: Tech stocks plunge on Cisco fears, Intel downgrade.

text.p: Shares of many leading technology stocks tumbled in late afternoon trading, due to fears of slowing growth at networking stalwart Cisco Systems Inc and a downgrade of Intel Corp.

Even though the downgrade of Intel was on a price basis, it helped fuel an overall decline in technology. PC leaders Compaq Computer Corp fell 5-1/4 to 79-3/8, Microsoft Corp dropped 5 to 98-1/8, Intel lost 7-7/8 to 156-7/8.
"It's the periodic technology meltdown," said one trader. "Everybody is 'Chicken Little' and they think the sky is falling. They are reading into the weakness in 3Com and Cisco."
"This year is a little slower than last year," Poyner said, but he added that Compaq remains his favorite stock.

He added some investors might have been nervous about a wide range of price cuts Monday by Compaq of desktops, notebooks and PCs. But the move was not indicative of demand weakness. "They have gone on the offensive here," Poyner said.

On Tuesday, networking stocks Xylan Corp and 3Com Corp dragged down the network sector, after Xylan's earnings were a penny shy of expectations. Last week 3Com executives warned analysts that a sales slowdown hit the company in December, despite a recovery in January.
"People are seeing the Cisco and 3Com order rates and they are thinking there is a slowing in the growth rates in PCs," said one technology stock trader.
Shares of Xylan were off slightly, easing 5/8 to 21-3/8. 3Com slipped 3-7/8 to 54-7/8.
"It's a bad day in the tech stadium," another trader said.
